pageContext.description: Unlooped, cast in a [bifid?] mould with trident ornamentation.
pageContext.other: Width: 73mm; at stop ridge 22mm; at butt 20mm,Thickness: at stop ridge 30mm,Weight: 490.75 gms
pageContext.publications: Arch. Cambrensis, LXXXIX, Part I, p. 124, fig. d half size. June 1934.
pageContext.remarks: Found by Mr. Edward Jones, Moaesmawr Caersws. Turned up by a plough in the nineties of the last century in a field or Trewythen Fawr Farm. The farm is some two miles SW Glaernos Village. The field 400 yards S.S.W of the house. Altitude about 650 ft. on a northern facing slope.
